titles.title: Dependence of public procurer on supplier
data view

descriptions.description: IDIMT-2022 Digitalization of society, business and management in a pandemic; 30th Interdisciplinary Information Management Talk / Chroust, Gerhard ; Doucek, Petr ; Oškrdal, Václav, page 211-218

Dependency in public and commercial procurement is considered as risk factor with several negative effects on procurement performance. Several studies or world of practice show 40% as risk threshold in commercial world. In the paper, we have analyzed data from Slovak public procurement from the view of dependency on supplier. Analysis shows that the relation between dependency and savings as possible negative effect is much more complex, although there are signals of negative trends. The paper motivates researcher to use data driven research to widen the gap in the research area to help decision makers in the field of spend management to improve their strategies based on data.
